item.title: Home
item.description: I am a researcher at the School of Computation, Information and Technology at Technische Universität München (TUM). My main research interest is the representation of linguistic information in Large Language Models and Machine Translation. I am also interested in compounds, collocations and idiomatic expressions. E-mail: marion.dimarco -AT- tum.de

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Blockseminar SoSe 2023 Linguistic Information in Large Language Models II 8. and 9. August 2023 In this seminar, we will read and discuss papers concerned with analyzing and representing linguistic information in large language models with a focus on semantics and the understanding of concepts and relations in LLMs, for example identifying metaphors, the understanding of compounds and ontological knowledge. The format of this seminar is similar to a reading group: participants should prepare a paper in advance and present it during the seminar as a basis for a discussion (see below for a list of papers), and also write a summary of the paper after the seminar.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Winter Semester 2024/2025 Masters Seminar: Concepts and Applications in NLP This seminar introduces linguistic background and essential topics in Natural Language Processing. The seminar starts with providing an overview of linguistic concepts and methods, such as morphology, part-of-speech tagging and grammars. We will then look at applications such as machine translation and language modeling. The seminar aims at providing a broad overview over different topics of NLP. Location: Room D2.01
